pr_title: KEYCLOAK-12875: User w/o pswd can't set pswd in new acct console.

timeline.bodyText:
Just a small nitpick. Of course I'm not a native speaker but "Signin" doesn't seem to be correct. Maybe it's some slang but even Google seems to be sure it's not used anywhere.
Shouldn't it be like this?

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            basic-auth-help-text=Signin with username and password.
          
          
            
            basic-auth-help-text=Sign in with username and password.
timeline.author: vmuzikar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -74,6 +74,8 @@ webauthn-display-name=Security Key
 webauthn-help-text=Use your security key to log in.
 webauthn-passwordless-display-name=Security Key
 webauthn-passwordless-help-text=Use your security key for passwordless log in.
+basic-authentication=Basic Authentication
+basic-auth-help-text=Signin with username and password.

replies.bodyText: I think you are right.  People use "Login", but I don't see "Signin".
replies.author: ssilvert

timeline.author: vmuzikar

timeline.message: KEYCLOAK-12875: User w/o pswd can't set pswd in new acct console.
